courseTitle: Operating Systems: Threads and Process Management
courseDescription: This course covers essential concepts in operating systems, focusing on threads, process synchronization, and CPU scheduling. Students will learn about thread management, synchronization mechanisms, and scheduling algorithms.

modules.title: Threads and Multicore Programming
modules.description: Introduction to threads, their benefits, and implementation models

modules.title: Process Synchronization
modules.description: Critical section problems, synchronization mechanisms, and classical synchronization problems

modules.title: CPU Scheduling
modules.description: Scheduling criteria, algorithms, and real-world implementations

prerequisites: Basic understanding of operating system concepts
learningObjectives: Understand the concept of threads and their benefits in operating systems
Differentiate between various threading models and libraries
Identify and solve critical section problems using synchronization mechanisms
Analyze and implement different CPU scheduling algorithms
Compare thread implementations across different operating systems
author: Operating Systems Department
